org.lwjgl.opengl

Class GPU_DEVICE

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lwjgl.system.PointerWrapper
      • org.lwjgl.system.Struct
        • org.lwjgl.opengl.GPU_DEVICE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Pointer

    public class GPU_DEVICE
extends Struct
    Receives information about the display device specified by the deviceIndex parameter of the WGLNVGPUAffinity.wglEnumGpuDevicesNV(long, int, org.lwjgl.opengl.GPU_DEVICE) function.

    GPU_DEVICE members

    MemberTypeDescription
    cbDWORDthe size of the GPU_DEVICE structure. Before calling WGLNVGPUAffinity.wglEnumGpuDevicesNV(long, int, org.lwjgl.opengl.GPU_DEVICE), set cb to the size, in bytes, of GPU_DEVICE.
    DeviceNameCHAR[32]a string identifying the display device name. This will be the same string as stored in the DeviceName field of the DISPLAY_DEVICE structure, which is filled in by EnumDisplayDevices.
    DeviceStringCHAR[128]a string describing the GPU for this display device. It is the same string as stored in the DeviceString field in the DISPLAY_DEVICE structure that is filled in by EnumDisplayDevices when it describes a display adapter (and not a monitor).
    FlagsDWORDindicates the state of the display device
    rcVirtualScreenRECTspecifies the display device rectangle, in virtual screen coordinates. The value of rcVirtualScreen is undefined if the device is not part of the desktop, i.e. DISPLAY_DEVICE_ATTACHED_TO_DESKTOP is not set in the Flags field.

      • GPU_DEVICE

      • GPU_DEVICE

        public GPU_DEVICE(java.nio.ByteBuffer container)
        Creates a GPU_DEVICE instance at the current position of the specified ByteBuffer container. Changes to the buffer's content will be visible to the struct instance and vice versa.

        The created instance holds a strong reference to the container object.
